Reviews.Title: “Safe, friendly, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: urbanpeach
Reviews.Content: I returned from a trip for my birthday several weeks ago. Being on a solo trip as a young female my biggest concern was safety. The hotel is in a great location and I had no worries about my safety at all. It is conveniently located 1/2 a block off of 5th Ave and is at the quieter end of 5th Ave so you don't have to worry about music blaring all night but you can easily get to the music if you wanted to. The hotel beside it has a bar but the live music is only twice a week and is over by 11 so it's not really a problem. Also there is a computer with free internet access at the front as well as a mini lending library. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. It's not luxurious but for what you are paying it is an excellent value. I would definitely stay here again! Thank you Carlos for making it a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, quiet, clean, affordable and helpful”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunky4
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel Coco Rio 4 times now. It is a great location just a 1/2 block off of 5th Ave. which is the pedestrian only street with tons of restaurants, shops and hotels. It's on the northern portion of 5th Ave. which is a little quieter and I think has access to the cleaner and better parts of the beach. The walk to the beach is only 5 minutes and the hotel gives you a discount on the chairs and umbrellas at Mamita's Beach Club. The staff speaks great English and is very helpful if you want excursions or need transportation to/from airport or anywhere else. You cannot beat this place for the price, location and peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Judith_SCanton
Reviews.Content: Hotel Coco Rio is a small, quiet hotel right off of busy 5th Avenue. While it does not offer many amenities, it is clean, attractive, is in a terrific location, and has an efficient and helpful staff. We have stayed there 8 times. This year, our air conditioning broke the night of our arrival. Coco Rio's staff arranged for an electrician and for lodging at a nearby hotel. The problem was corrected the next day. We were also given a bottle of wine and transportation to the airport to compensate for the inconvenience. We'll go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price said!”
Reviews.Author: billiejoece
Reviews.Content: Well, let´s start saying that is one of the cheapest options i´ve found in this range of price. Its a simple place to stay, but comfortable. I had some problems with the shower, the water wasn´t very strong and it was a hard time getting the temperature in balance. However I didn´t ask staff to fix it, cause i could take my baths anyway. People around there are polite, although not very expansive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice littel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flemming A
Reviews.Content: Nice littel hotel, with nice people and know want godd service is; and always avaiable with help

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a budget mind with A+ location!!”
Reviews.Author: joferto
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here previously couple times before just for one night on my way to the airport and this time we stayed for two nights. We got a great rate and our room was the standard located on the first floor. We had a king size bed, TV, AC, the bathroom was very clean and the hot/running water with no problem. The amenities were good and the room was keep always clean and in good service. The staff is very helfpul and attentive, and even though we had our car and the place has not parking, we were lucky to park our car right by the entrance of the hotel, considering the low season. The location is super cool, you are right in the middle of everything and far away enough of the main "antros" and bars so you could sleep at night but also walking distance of all these places. Taxis were available at anytime as well. My parents stay for one night next week on their way to cancun airport and they love it. Right next to the hotel is a little italian place with awsome coffee and pastries. PDC is not a cheap place, especially around that area, but it is definetely very safe and well mainteined. I will come back whenever I have the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, cheap price”
Reviews.Author: melleln
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at Coco Rio: cheap hotel, great location. Even though the staff didnt speak much english, they were doing their best to help. The hotel is very nice: interior garden with a fountain and rooftop terrrace. Plenty of restaurants near by, walking distance to the beach and main street. We found parking for the car in the street. I recommend this hotel for travellers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in the Italian zone”
Reviews.Author: farmer000000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in May to do some diving in Playa. The hotel is a quiet hotel tucked in a 1/4 block from 5 th ave. My room was basic room small tv small mini fridge safe king bed bathroom and closet. It had air as well,very clean and maid did a wonderful job every day.I would stay here again for the price I got.Great little hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: artful99
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to Playa and my second time at Coco Rio. Love this place. The hotel is situated at the quieter part of town and close to the best beach. Staff is friendly and helpful. Will always stay here when in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “totally worth it!”
Reviews.Author: antonioibal
Reviews.Content: I´ve stayed in Coco Rio hotel with a couple of friends last week. We originally planed to stay only 4 nights but by the end of day four we decided to move our plans of going to cancun and enjoy coco rio and amazing playa del carmen nightlife and beaches another night , we really received a gentle treatment for the whole staff (Juan Carlos the front desk manager ---who treated us amazing booking our last minute reservation and giving us a 3 double bed room at the top floor with balcony for a reeeeally good price----, the owner, the night shift girl ,even from Don Francisco the night guardian giving us a smile when we came back from partying at late night hours o should i say early in the mornirng hahaha) I truly recommend Coco Rio hotel is well located in the italian neighborhood , great restaurants near by and just 2 block away from playa mamitas and kool beach club , which are the places to be when u´re w/ friends.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, simple, clean and affordable with a friendly english-speaking staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunky4
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel Coco Rio the last two times I've been to Playa Del Carmen. It's conveniently located just off of 5th Ave. and further north than the busier and noisier part of 5th ave. It is also a short walk to Mamita's beach club which is a great place to hang out on the beach. It's also closer to a lot of the restaurants that I prefer. The staff is very friendly and accommodating and speak English very well. They responded back to my emails quickly and were very helpful. If you want to book a room with them, email them directly to their email address and you may be able to save some money rather than booking it online.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!! Total ripoff”
Reviews.Author: JaySchwag
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 nights at the Coco Rio based on reviews here but I will never stay there again. The good... The layout of the hotel is quite nice. Lots of trees, nice little courtyard, hammock outside my room. The room is very clean and the bed is comfy. Good location at the end of 5th ave. The BAD... I asked for a late checkout of 8pm in my booking note and again when I arrived. Despite that, on my last day, I was told that my request had disappeared. Coincidentally, they needed my room for another guest who decided to stay longer. So they booted me very quickly to make more off someone else and I had to go pay a full night at a hotel across the street. I asked them to arrange an airport shuttle (which their info says they do) and all of a sudden their english got worse. There is no way you work in playa and don't know the words Airport Shuttle. Terrible service. The room had NO HOT WATER. They told me to let it run for 10 minutes. After 20 minutes it was barely tepid with no pressure. The key for my door only worked when it wanted to, often leaving me fiddling for 5+ minutes. The tv remote didn't work either. For $100 us per night, this place is a total rip-off. I went across the street and got a better room with better service for $65us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: chewi2005
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was a pleasant surprise. I would say it is the cleanest hotel I have stayed in. Nice large room with balcony. Beautiful courtyard and nice private sunning deck. Nice location close to the beach and on a side street so it is not directly on 5th Ave. There is music next door on Wed and Fri but it is over by 11PM .Plenty of places to eat close by. Best internet connection is outside but plenty of outside tables and seating. We stayed a week and would stay again next time we are in Mexico. Very nice friendly cat named Blanca . We got quite attached to her!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,pretty courtyard, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: artful99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights and loved this hotel. Near Mamitas Beach and away for the noise. Would differently stay there again. Price was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: NWUSBeachBums
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Coco Rio for 2 nights. We've traveled to this area for the last eight years and thought the location was great being on the quiet end of town. The hotel is just off 5th street for easy access to restaurants and the beach. I don't remember the name of the restaurant on the corner but they had very good food and is very close to Coco Rio. The staff at this small, pleasant hotel were very friendly and helpful. We highly recommend the Coco RIo for short stays in Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Coco Rio is a great small boutique hotel that is clean and quite nice”
Reviews.Author: ldevost
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the Coco Rio for $80 american a night all taxes included. The room was spacious with large doors that opened up to a small balconey with chairs on it overlooking the streeet. Room was a executive with 2 double beds, Kitchenette and really cool bathroom. This hotel also has a hammock and sitting room in every level of rooms that look out onto the inner courtyard. A small hotel of not more than 30 rooms that are set really neat around the courtyard. The rooms are very clean and spacious, front desk spoke fluent English. It is situated on the North end of 5th street on Playa Del Carma and quiet. Beside it is the Luna Hotel which is rated around the top 10 places to stay in Playa but twice as expensive and I believe no better. Only complaint was water pressure for showers but on second day it improved for whatever reason. I would stay there again. The Luna Hotel beside has a lounge and live music which plays until around 11 pm. If you are going to bed earlier ask for room away from the lounge which butts up against one side of the Coco Rio Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Iowa Winter Getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: IowaSun
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel was super friendly and very helpful! The location was wonderful. We were wanting a quieter location and Hotel Coco Rio is it!! A perfect walk to the beach and down 5th avenue. Our room had everything we wanted and was very spacious and cleaned everyday. We would highly recommmend this hotel!!! We will stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: EnglandDucks
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, on the quiet end of 5th avenue (which meant we could sleep! as 5th gets very noisy, especially at night) Was very close to Mamitas beach, which is probably the best part of the beach, and gave good discounts on the loungers/sunshades etc at mamitas. And a minute's walk to the 'main stretch' of 5th ave, and most places in town. >>Though I will warn anyone interested on going there that taxi drivers generally wont have a clue where you mean! If you're not staying at Gran Porto Real or The Royal which are the two big hotels in town then good luck trying to get anywhere as it seems the taxi drivers dont really have a clue about anywhere other than the bigger hotels...where they obviously get the most money!<< The staff at Coco Rio were fantastic, helpful, cheerful and understanding. They gave us directions and tips on the best places to visit/eat etc, were always happy to help with big proper smiles, and I found their english exceptional considering this is MEXICO!!!!! they helped us with our mexican too which was greatly appreciated :) Our room was also fantastic. We stayed in room 30 which was one of the standard rooms.. it had a large comfortable double bed, tv, fridge, table and chairs, air conditioning (that worked so well we almost had to get jumpers and trousers!) and a bathroom! The housekeepers kept the rooms very clean and always made a point of saying hello and thanking us when we left them tips however much or little we left. The shower took a while to heat up but this seems to be normal for mexico, and you really dont want a steaming hot shower in the heat of Mexico! Overall we had a fantastic stay at the coco rio which made our holiday perfect. I think people who give bad reviews about coco rio need to remember this is a 3 star hotel in Mexico and I think you would be hard pushed to find a hotel of this quality, price and service in either the USA or Europe!!! I'd like to say thank you to the staff at Coco Rio!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great price, central location”
Reviews.Author: Yabolo
Reviews.Content: I see that the reviews are mixed for this property and maybe it's because the rooms differ. I came to the Coco Rio escaping from Luna Blue (after stupidly paying in advance for three nights at a time when nearly every hotel in town is begging for business). My room at Coco Rio was huge, beautifully remodelled, immaculate and had lots of light. It was cheaper than the tiny dark room I had been assigned at Luna Blue. The staff were friendly and helpful. The common areas were light and pleasant. The location is great for anyone wanting to be near the action on the touristy main drag -- and it's only a couple of blocks from the beach. Definitely a thumbs up but you might want to get a commitment for a specific room.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for location, price, service”
Reviews.Author: wanderingaddict
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect - quiet end of 5th, yet close to beach, restaurants and supplies. We had a front room (#33) facing the street, yet there was no noise at all. The room was large and bright, although we noticed that some of the interior rooms seemed to be a little on the small size. Our room had a small kitchenette that was adequate for making a light breakfast and sandwiches for lunch, however I wouldn't recommend it for making dinner - why would you since there's great little restaurants within a couple of blocks (try Garden of Eating or Diez). The cleaning staff were immaculate and always friendly. We had fresh towels every day and never ran out of soap. We could have eaten off the floor, the room was so clean! The girl on the front desk was a real sweetheart and made our 11 day stay seem like we were staying with friends - I hope management realizes what a gem they have in her front desk skills. Like most hotels in this category, the water takes a long, long time to get hot (actually warm), but that is par for the course and should not be a reason not to stay here. This isn't a five star hotel, so one can always find something to fault, but there isn't much to fault here. We travel extensively throughout Asia and central and south America and always stay in this category of Hotel. We can honestly say that this is one of the better ones we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: StewartsLucy
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th year in a row taking a winter break to PDC. As we have gotten to know PDC, we seem to want to stay further north each year. Our budget was tighter this year, so to make our trip happen, we decided to go for a budget hotel. That is how we decided upon Hotel Coco Rio. They require you to pay cash up front for the $88 per night rate. Pay for six nights get one free. We knew it was risky should something go wrong, but we took the plunge. We stayed in a standard room, number 10. When we checked in, the desk clerk was quite ill with a fever and did her best to give us the scoop as far as safety deposit box, towels, beach, places for breakfast. It was a bit strange. I was hoping I wouldn't catch whatever it was she had! The room was very small. You could hardly sit on the toilet as there was not much aisle space in front of it. But the plumbing, A/C and cable TV worked fine. We did have to have someone come in to get the cable TV going. The safety deposit box would not accomodate a laptop if you bring one. This time we didn't and it turned out to be a good thing. We did purchase cleaning supplies to clean the white closet and bathroom doors. They were covered in black fingerprints & dirt. Once we did this, it was fine. We also purchased a light bulb for the bedside lamp. The globe around the bathroom lamp was cracked and we reported it the day before we left, but it still had not been replaced. The closet space was good. We also had a wood table with 2 chairs. Two small bedside tables each witha drawer and a lamp. There is no shelf or counterspace in the bathroom whatsoever. So we requested a little plastic table we saw on the balconies and they brought us one. There is a refridgerator that works well. Though it was kinda rusty. The space around the bed is tight. My husband & I could barely walk along the same passageway at the same time in the room. I did request the bed to be made with the blanket in between two sheets, and the maids did it this way each day for us. Someone at the desk did ask us if we would mind using our beach towels two days in a row before replacing them using a save the planet approach. But there is but one small towel rack in this room, placed quite low on the wall. You could manage a hand towel on it. No line to pull across shower to hang dry...and the beach towels were pretty sandy from all the wind at the beach. We think they wanted to save on their laundry bill. The staff was pleasant, but it is a bare bones operation. What few requests we did make, they tried to address promptly. If you are looking for a basic hotel, then this would do. There is nothing fancy about it. The location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed - Room Not as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: Isle 'n Sun
Reviews.Content: There must be a huge disparity between rooms. Or, it is a huge disparity between the travelers experience level. This hotel room (Executive) was misrepresented. Our room was small and had no furniture (one small wooden chair -we had to use second bed to spread out clothes). The manager was not in and front desk people would not move us to another room. Yet one was available. We stayed 4 nights. Trapped, as payment was required in advance. With all the good reviews we were not concerned. The manager showed up the next to last night and offered to move us. Way too late. Experience was terrible. There is a TravelAdvisor Award Winning Hotel next door. If you go to Coco Rio you will see it. The picture in brochure DOES NOT accurately describe Executive room. Picture of exterior of hotel is not today. About 5-7 years ago. Palm trees in front are very tall and obscure most of the front of hotel. It is good location. But there are others. I provided my problems to Hotels.com and they issued a sizable refund. It was appreciated. But, did not make up for the poor accommodations at Coco Rio. In summary, we travel expensively. We stay in 0* to 5* accommodations. We have stayed at some marginal places, to be sure. But they got a good, to very good, rating in TripAdvisor. Why? Because we rate hotels not on stars but answering the question, "would we go back to the same hotel for approximately the same price?" This place, Coco Rio, NO!!! We got screwed. The room was not as advertised. Take a chance on this place and you may get the room we were provided. Go somewhere else. I will accept questions. PS: I have never added photos to any of my reviews. Photos Will Be posted for this one. You can see the truth, for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, quiet, and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: cubuff1453
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November of 07. Walked in off the street after my first choice (Luna Blue-which is literally next door) was full. Offered a great rate of $60/night if I paid cash. Room was clean, adequate size, had cable tv, and quiet. Bathroom was roomy, complete, and my only complaint was water pressure was somewhat weak. Great location. Only steps off the quieter end of 5th ave on 26th. The better end of 5th ave. if you ask me with great little bars and restaurants all within a block, and Mamitas, which is the best beach club in Playa only 2 blocks away. Service was decent, not 5 star, but you aren't paying 5 star prices. Good choice for under $100 in a resort town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Coco Rio”
Reviews.Author: catrina3574
Reviews.Content: Charming, charming, charming! We stayed here for a week, with family and friends meeting from Oshkosh, Minneapolis, and Aberdeen, Scotland. There were six of us, so we booked three rooms. The location was absolutely wonderful, with all the fun of the beach and Fifth Avenue just a short walk away. There's a small mercado just across the street, making it easy to get food and other supplies, and a great little restaurant called La Quinta Pasion next door. Make it a point to eat at La Quinta at least once! The seating is outdoors, but is covered, the food is excellent and inexpensive, and the waitstaff wonderfully attentive. Hotel rooms were clean, AC ice cold, and the staff very friendly. We had our one and only issue with the bathroom plumbing getting clogged. We didn't realize that in Mexico the pipes are of a smaller diameter, and therefore paper should be discarded separately. (The restaurants in the city and at places like Tulum make it clear that paper should not go into the toilets! Live and learn!) The staff was very nice about it and got a plumber to come by on a Saturday night! There's loads of closet space, table and chairs, a a hutch with lots of storage space, TV's in room - we watched "Friends" dubbed in Spanish with English subtitles. It was hilarious! The beds were firm, but not unbearable so, and the bathroom with shower was roomy. We brought a supply of small items from The Dollar Store to leave out for the maids, along with some cash, each morning, and had no problems with cleaning or linens at all. We would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice location but service is lacking...”
Reviews.Author: DivingViking
Reviews.Content: Yes the hotel looks charming at first sight and I do like the mexican feel to it..... However we were promised a kitchenette but only go a tiny fridge inside our closet. The room had a very dodgy door (i.e. a piece of cake to break into if someone were to try) so we decided to go for the safe.... So I paid USD 50 as a deposit in order to receive the key to the safe...so I wouldn´t steal the key... what I would do with a key to a safe in Mexico who knows.... but they did give me a receipt. So when we are leaving - early morning - noone there had any money to return the deposit. Note that I had let them know the day before that I would be checking out early so I would need my $50 back but to no avail. The receptionist could not give me the money, he could not call the owner so he promised to send me the money... yeah right! At this point I knew I could forget about the money but decided to fill in the form anyways. For a few weeks after my return I was in contact with the hotel regarding the missing money. They told me that they had sent it but I never received anything. After a while the management told me they had fired this guy....but you know somehow I don´t believe them. The rooms had it's charm and having lived in Mexico it did bring back memories and I like my bed firm. As to my partner, he was not too thrilled...but we didn´t plan to spend anytime there anyways so we managed. Other aspects: the bathroom was tiny as well as the balcony. They did keep everything clean and indeed were able to point me to a really good taco place where I could get my fix of Tacos Al Pastor (the place is El Fogón and I reccommend it for anyone looking for real mexican tacos). It is nice to walk through the courtyard to the rooms and the balcony, albeit small, was very nice. Since we were busy diving most of the time we only used the beach once and that was very nice...although rather crowded. I am conflicted whether to reccommend this hotel or not - it has it's upsides and downsides. But if you are looking for luxury or new furniture you should skip it - if you are looking for a good location and are fine with old furniture, hard beds, very dodgy doors and a tiny bathroom then I guess it is fine...

Reviews.Title: “okay place”
Reviews.Author: Dasini
Reviews.Content: Got a pretty negative start at this place when the receptionist wanted us to sign a blank Visa voucher. This has happened to us before in Mexico and we absolutely hate the idea of it. It would be so easy for hotelowners to fill in some random amount and withdraw it from our account - they already have our signature! But seeing as we had already payed for our stayed - we were forced to do this. Otherwise we would lose money for not cancelling our reservation in time. Anyways the hotel was okay - great location - not on the beach but very close to it and very close to shopping and dining. Also the room was clean. One other thing we didnt care for, was the fact that there was absolutely no waterpressure and when we made the staff aware of this, a guy came to the room and blew some air into the showerhead - although this was rather entertaining - it did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aineetiny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at coco rio for 3 nights in room number 22, garden view...queen bed, fridge, a/c, hairdryer, Cable TV, large closet....Large bathroom. NO shampoo..just soaps, the only thing that was a little anoying was the shower took to long for hot water, but other than that it was great. This hotel is 2 blocks from the beach...60 dlls a night...they give you day passes for mamitas beach club...and they rent you beach towels at 5dlls valid for the whole stay. There are safes in the rooms...but it´s 2 dlls per day. Front desk staff is really nice, we saw the owner almost everyday, she is really friendly and helpfull. Ac worked well, room cleaned daily...there are two little convinience stores just accross the street, several bars and restaurants at street level....I would recommend this hotel...Great place at a great price.

HotelInfo.Name: Coco Rio Playa del Carmen
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 26 no 125 | Entre 5ta y 10a Avenida, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
